Resuming a Pension Award When an Incarcerated Child Is the Only Child
If the incarcerated child was the only child, and the surviving spouseâ€™s pension award was discontinued because his/her income exceeded the limit for a surviving spouse with no dependents, resumption from the date of release is contingent upon the timely submission of evidence reestablishing entitlement.
